poem:
"Spectacle on the Small Screen"

Grim jesters, faces hidden,
Storm the stage of life unbidden.
Silence guns impose and affright,
Echoed pleas of flightless fright.
Their currency in chaos traded,
The truce of humanity degraded.
A tersity of terror, seeds sown,
In the land of sun, the shadow grown.
"A price," they claim, "for trifling jest,
The reaping, stark, for unholy harvest."

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
